22-0978.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a report from the Deputy City Manager and staff exploring the feasibility of reducing the City’s adult-use cannabis retail tax rate to align with the medical cannabis retail tax rate.Katy Nomura, Deputy City Manager, spoke; and introduced Valencia Mota, Cannabis Oversight Manager.Valencia Mota, Cannabis Oversight Manager, spoke; and provided a PowerPoint presentation.Katy Nomura, Deputy City Manager, spoke; and continued the PowerPoint presentation.Chair Mungo spoke.Councilwoman Allen spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Mungo and Councilwoman Allen.Valencia Mota, Cannabis Oversight Manager, spoke.Councilwoman Allen spoke.A dialogue ensued between Councilwoman Allen and Valencia Mota, Cannabis Oversight Manager.Katy Nomura, Deputy City Manager, spoke.Chair Mungo spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Mungo and Katy Nomura, Deputy City Manager.Page 2 of 3TELECONFERENCE, 2:00 PMTHURSDAY, AUGUST 18, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE MINUTESCouncilwoman Allen spoke.Chair Mungo spoke.A dialogue ensued between Chair Mungo and Councilwoman Allen.A motion was made by Chair Mungo, seconded by Member Allen, to approve recommendation, as amended to [1] adopt a mixture of scenario’s 4 and 5 to preserve services & program levels funded by the current $12 million baseline in FY 23, including annual adjustments to maintain those levels of service; [2] research modifying the cultivation tax to be based off of gross sales.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 2 - Mungo and AllenAbsent: 1 - Richardson3.
